issue.title: [fund.ts.v3] propagate_const's swap's noexcept specification needs to be constrained and use a trait

discussion.p: In the Fundamentals TS, the noexcept specifications of both the member and non-member swap functions for propagate_const are using the old, ill-formed pattern of attempting to use "noexcept(swap(...))" as the boolean predicate. According to LWG , this is ill-formed, and a resolution such as in P0185R1 is required.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4840.

li.p: Modify , class template propagate_const synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: // , propagate_const modifiers constexpr void swap(propagate_const& pt) noexcept(see belowis_nothrow_swappable_v<T>);
constexpr void swap(propagate_const& pt) noexcept(see belowis_nothrow_swappable_v<T>);

blockquote.p:
-2- The constant-expression in the exception-specification is noexcept(swap(t_, pt.t_)).
-3- Effects: swap(t_, pt.t_).

blockquote.pre: template <class T> constexpr void swap(propagate_const<T>& pt1, propagate_const<T>& pt2) noexcept(see belowis_nothrow_swappable_v<T>);

blockquote.p:
-2- The constant-expression in the exception-specification is noexcept(pt1.swap(pt2)).
-3- Effects: pt1.swap(pt2).

discussion.p: This issue has very much overlap with LWG , especially now that the library fundamentals has been rebased to C++20 the there reported problem for the corresponding swap problem for optional is now mood. During the reflector discussion of this issue here it was also observed that the free swap template for propagate_const needs to be constrained. This has been done below in the revised wording which also attempts to use a similar style as the IS.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4840.

li.p: Modify , class template propagate_const synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: // , propagate_const modifiers constexpr void swap(propagate_const& pt) noexcept(see belowis_nothrow_swappable_v<T>);
constexpr void swap(propagate_const& pt) noexcept(see belowis_nothrow_swappable_v<T>);

blockquote.p:
-2- The constant-expression in the exception-specification is noexcept(swap(t_, pt.t_)).
-3- Effects: swap(t_, pt.t_).

blockquote.pre: template <class T> constexpr void swap(propagate_const<T>& pt1, propagate_const<T>& pt2) noexcept(see below);

blockquote.p:
-?- Constraints: is_swappable_v<T> is true.
-2- Remarks: The constant-expression in the exception-specification is noexcept(pt1.swap(pt2)).
-3- Effects: pt1.swap(pt2).
